a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Fish stocks and fishing intensity by group, Tuna
Fish stocks are measured by biomass: the number of individuals multiplied by their mass. Fishing intensity by the
fraction of the fish population that is caught in a given year.
Both are given as a ratio of their levels at the maximum sustainable yield â€“ the level at which we can catch the
maximum amount of fish without a decline in fish populations. A value of one maximises fish catch without
decreasing fish populations. This is the target level.

text.textPath: Biomass or fishing intensity at maximum sustainable yield
Biomass or fishing intensity at maximum sustainable yield

text.tspan: Data source: RAM Legacy Database; Hilborn,et al. (2020). Effective fisheries management instrumental in improving fish stock status.
